intro: Antennaria rhodantha, commonly known as the pink sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its dense clusters of tiny, pink to red flowers. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with slender, branched stems and small, hairy leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Antennaria rhodantha is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-elevation ecosystems.
